text: How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment."
If I'm getting paid 30 cents I might as well just donate all of it because it's such a small amount.
Very good, thank you. The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children
Okay. What children are we saving?
Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
Are you a real person or a computer?
I am a real person, chatting via an MTurk Survey. How about yourself?
I'm a robot.
Excellent. What is the meaning of life?
What do you think the meaning of life is?
To Save the Children! As a robot you might find it interesting to review their website at  URL
What do you have on your side of the screen? Is it like information about the charity and stuff?
Yes there are suggestions and suggested textual responses. Yours?
It's basically nothing. That's kind of why I'm confused.
It is confusing.
Do we have to wait the full ten minutes? This robot's committed to donating.

10 Chat turns I believe. Here is an example of one of my instructions to get you to donate: "Use guilt appeal: You can persuade by making your partner guilty. You can ask how much money do they spend on unnecessary stuff like a bag of snack or candyÃ¿ and remind them that money can be used in more meaningful ways. Small donations will indeed help a lot of children and their families. Convince your partner they are a part of the solution and they have the moral responsibility to help."
Hahaha that's a good one. But unfortunately not necessary. Do you think people really put up arguments in here?
Honestly I have no idea.

If there\'s one after this maybe I will just to spice things up. Mine just says "Welcome to the communication task. You will now start a conversation with your partner about a children's charity. Please don't game the task by replying short and meaningless sentences."
Have a nice day!
